entities.description: "ELMo is a pre-trained encoder used in the experiments for producing representations of candidate mentions in context."
"GloVe is used as an alternative to ELMo for non-contextualized word representations in the experiments."
"WIKIHOP is a dataset used for training, validation/development, and testing of the model, with specific query-document samples."
"Welbl et al., 2018 are the authors who constructed the WIKIHOP dataset and are referenced for its description."
"R-GCN refers to the Relational Graph Convolutional Network model used in the experiments, with a gated version of the original propagation rule."
"DOC-BASED is one of the available relations used in the R-GCN model, indicating a type of edge annotation."
"MATCH is one of the available relations used in the R-GCN model, indicating a type of edge annotation."
"COREF is one of the available relations used in the R-GCN model, indicating a type of edge annotation."
"COMPLEMENT is one of the available relations used in the R-GCN model, indicating a type of edge annotation."
"$\mathbf{h}_{i}^{(0)}$ represents the initial hidden node representation in the R-GCN model, initialized with query-aware encodings."
"$\mathbf{u}_{i}^{(\ell)}$ represents the update message to the ith node in the R-GCN model at layer $\ell$."
"${\mathcal{N}}_{i}$ represents the set of indices of nodes neighboring the ith node in the R-GCN model."
"${\mathcal{R}}_{i j}$ represents the set of edge annotations between nodes i and j in the R-GCN model."
"${\bf a}_{i}^{(\ell)}$ represents the gate levels computed for the ith node at layer $\ell$ in the R-GCN model."
"$\mathbf{h}_{i}^{(\ell+1)}$ represents the updated representation of the ith node at layer $\ell+1$ in the R-GCN model."
"$\phi(\cdot)$ represents any nonlinear function used in the R-GCN model, specifically the tanh function."
"$f_{s}$ is a parametrized function specific to a node representation in the R-GCN model."
"$f_{r}$ is a parametrized function specific to an edge type in the R-GCN model."
"$f_{a}$ is a parametrized transformation used in the computation of gate levels in the R-GCN model."

relationships.description: "ELMo and GloVe are both used in the experiments for producing representations, with ELMo being contextualized and GloVe being non-contextualized."
"ELMo is used in the experiments that utilize the WIKIHOP dataset for training, validation, and testing."
"R-GCN uses DOC-BASED as one of the available relations for edge annotations in the model."
"R-GCN uses MATCH as one of the available relations for edge annotations in the model."

entities.description: "R-GCN-layers refer to the layers used in a graph convolutional network, maintaining the dimensionality of node representations."
"MLP stands for multi-layer perceptron, a type of neural network used in the described model."
"WIKIHOP is an event or dataset used for evaluating model performance with different numbers of R-GCN-layers."
"Adam optimizer is an optimization algorithm used for training the models, referenced in the context of Kingma and Ba's work."
"Dropout is a regularization technique used to prevent overfitting, with various drop rates mentioned."

Entity-GCN is a model evaluated for its performance and instances of failure in the WIKIHOP development set. It is also analyzed in terms of its accuracy with respect to the input graph size, specifically candidate and node set sizes.
"Eslöv is a city mentioned in the context of ambiguity in model prediction between city and county entities."
"Scania County, also known as Skåne County, is a geographical entity where the city of Eslöv is located."
"Kingma and Ba are the authors of the 2015 paper where the Adam optimizer was introduced."
"Srivastava et al. are the authors of the 2014 paper related to the dropout technique used in the model."
"The validation set is used to evaluate the model's performance and to apply early-stopping based on accuracy."
"Table 6 presents samples from the WIKIHOP development set where Entity-GCN fails, indicating model shortcomings."
"Figure 3 shows the model performance in relation to the input graph size, specifically candidate and node set sizes."
"Table 5 describes the model architecture, providing details on the components and structure of the model."
"Pearson’s correlation is a statistical measure used to assess the relationship between two variables, mentioned in the context of model performance and set sizes."

relationships.description: "The R-GCN-layers and MLP are components of the model architecture, with the latter taking the output of the former."
"The performance of R-GCN-layers is evaluated using the WIKIHOP dataset, with specific observations made about the number of layers."
"The Adam optimizer is used in the training process of the MLP model."
"Dropout is employed in conjunction with the MLP to combat overfitting during training."
"Entity-GCN's performance is analyzed on the WIKIHOP development set, with specific failures reported."
"Eslöv is a city located within Scania County, creating ambiguity in the model's predictions."
"Kingma and Ba introduced the Adam optimizer in their 2015 paper."
"Srivastava et al. are associated with the concept of dropout, as they wrote the 2014 paper on the subject."
"The Entity-GCN model's performance is evaluated using the accuracy on the validation set."
"Table 6 reports specific instances where Entity-GCN fails, providing insight into the model's performance."
"Figure 3 illustrates the performance of Entity-GCN in relation to the size of the input graph."
"Table 5 describes the architecture of Entity-GCN, detailing its components and structure."
"Pearson’s correlation is used to measure the relationship between model performance and set sizes for Entity-GCN."

entities.description: "R-GCN is a component of a model that contributes to its performance in multi-hop reasoning and entity relation tasks."
"ELMo is a model that, when replaced by GloVe in the R-GCN system, still yields competitive results in terms of accuracy."
"GloVe is a model that can replace ELMo in the R-GCN system, maintaining competitive accuracy levels."
"Welbl et al., 2018 are referenced for their baselines in accuracy comparison with the R-GCN model."
"Dhingra et al., 2018 are referenced for their Coref-GRU model, which is outperformed by the R-GCN model."
"WIKIPHOP is an event or dataset used to test the effectiveness of the R-GCN model in multi-hop inference."

Entity-GCN is a model evaluated for its performance and instances of failure in the WIKIHOP development set. It is also analyzed in terms of its accuracy with respect to the input graph size, specifically candidate and node set sizes.
"DOC-BASED refers to connections of mentions that co-occur in the same document, which the model uses effectively."
"MATCH refers to connections between mentions that match exactly, which play a less significant role in the model."
"COREF refers to edges predicted by the coreference system, which also play a marginal role in the model."
"Coref-GRU is a model developed by Dhingra et al. (2018), which is outperformed by the R-GCN model without accessing context."
"Table 3 is referenced multiple times in the text, showing comparisons between different models and their performances."
"WIKIHOP validation set is the dataset used to evaluate the performance of different models, particularly the Entity-GCN."
"Induced edges refer to the experiment where edges are not predetermined but predicted, showing a drop in performance."
"Bilinear function is used to predict the importance of a single edge connecting two nodes in the 'Induced edges' experiment."
"Section 2.3 is referenced as the source of information regarding the query-dependent representation of mentions."
"Masked settings refer to the scenario where the coreference resolution system is not applied due to masking."
"Unmasked setting refers to the scenario where mentions to an entity may differ and the coreference system may not retrieve them, making the task harder."
"MASK1 is an example of a unique surface form used to refer to an entity within and across documents in the masked version."
A geo-location used to illustrate entity mention differences and the concept of different degrees of granularity in entity mentions, compared with 'US' and 'London'.
A source of information that may have mismatches with what is annotated in Wikidata, affecting model performance and used as a reference for model comparison.

relationships.description: "R-GCN component is part of a system that can be used with ELMo, showing competitive results."
"R-GCN component is part of a system that can be used with GloVe, showing competitive results."
"R-GCN outperforms the baselines set by Welbl et al., 2018 in terms of accuracy."
"R-GCN outperforms the Coref-GRU model by Dhingra et al., 2018 in terms of accuracy."
"Entity-GCN makes better use of DOC-BASED connections than MATCH or COREF connections."
"Entity-GCN uses MATCH connections, but they play a less significant role than DOC-BASED connections."
"Entity-GCN uses COREF connections, but they play a marginal role in the model."
"The R-GCN model outperforms the Coref-GRU model, which is developed by Dhingra et al. (2018)."
"Table 3 shows comparisons between the Entity-GCN model and other models, indicating its performance."
"The Entity-GCN model is evaluated on the WIKIHOP validation set to measure its performance."
"The 'Induced edges' experiment uses a bilinear function to predict the importance of edges, showing a drop in performance."
"The bilinear function used in the 'Induced edges' experiment is explained in Section 2.3."
"The masked settings and unmasked setting are two different scenarios in which the coreference resolution system's performance is evaluated."

entities.description: "Welbl et al. (2018) are researchers who published results related to multi-hop QA and are referenced for their work on human performance benchmarks."
"WIKIHOP is an event or setting used for testing and training models in the context of multi-hop question answering, created by Welbl et al. (2018)."

Entity-GCN is a model evaluated for its performance and instances of failure in the WIKIHOP development set. It is also analyzed in terms of its accuracy with respect to the input graph size, specifically candidate and node set sizes.
A source of information that may have mismatches with what is annotated in Wikidata, affecting model performance and used as a reference for model comparison.
A knowledge base that contains annotations that may differ from information in Wikipedia, impacting model accuracy and used for comparison with Wikipedia.
"Lee et al. (2017) are referenced for their end-to-end coreference resolution system used to identify mentions in the Entity graph."
"BiDAF is a model mentioned for comparison, indicating it is slower to train than the proposed model in the text."
"ELMo is a contextualized embedding model used to obtain initial representations of nodes in the proposed approach."
"RNN encoders are mentioned as an alternative to the approach used in the Entity-GCN model for obtaining node representations."
A type of model that has been successful on various NLP tasks, including document level modeling, and mentioned in the context of multi-document QA and knowledge base reasoning.
"A relational graph convolutional network is part of the Entity-GCN model, responsible for propagating information through the entity graph."
"A document encoder is used in the Entity-GCN model to obtain representations of mentions in context."
"Vrandeˇci´c is the author referenced for the use of WIKIDATA as a knowledge base."
"The query/question is part of the WIKIHOP dataset, representing the input for which the model must find the correct answer."
"Supporting documents are part of the WIKIHOP dataset, provided to the QA system to help find the correct answer to a query."
"Candidate answers are part of the WIKIHOP dataset, representing potential answers to a query."
"The subject entity is part of the triples in the knowledge base, representing one component of the relation."
"The object entity is part of the triples in the knowledge base, representing another component of the relation."
"The unidirectional relation is part of the triples in the knowledge base, connecting subject and object entities."

relationships.description: "Welbl et al. (2018) created the WIKIHOP event for testing multi-hop QA models."
"Entity-GCN is a model that achieves improvements over previous results in the WIKIHOP setting."
"WIKIHOP uses WIKIPEDIA as a corpus for assembling the dataset."
"WIKIHOP uses WIKIDATA as a knowledge base for constructing the dataset."
"Entity-GCN utilizes the coreference resolution system by Lee et al. (2017) to create an entity graph."
"Entity-GCN is compared to BiDAF, showing it is faster to train."
"Entity-GCN substitutes ELMo with simple pre-trained word embeddings and still performs on par with other techniques."
"Entity-GCN does not use RNN encoders, instead relying on contextualized embeddings and graph neural networks."
"Entity-GCN uses graph neural networks for information propagation across documents."
"The relational graph convolutional network is a component of the Entity-GCN model."
"The document encoder is a component of the Entity-GCN model used to obtain representations of mentions in context."

"WIKIHOP is a multi-document question answering dataset created by Welbl et al., 2018, which requires multi-step reasoning and information combination from different documents."
"SQuAD is a large-scale reading comprehension dataset created by Rajpurkar et al., 2016, enabling end-to-end training of neural models."
"CNN/Daily Mail is a large-scale reading comprehension dataset created by Hermann et al., 2015, enabling end-to-end training of neural models."

"Transformer-like self-attention is a mechanism used in some neural networks, mentioned in comparison to the Entity-GCN method."
"Jump-links are used in the method by Dhingra et al. (2018) to augment RNNs with co-reference edges for multi-hop reasoning."
"Weaver is a method that uses document concatenation in a multi-hop setting, as mentioned in the paper."
"MHPGM is another method that uses document concatenation in a multi-hop setting, as mentioned in the paper."

"Daniel Weld is a researcher who has co-authored a publication with Mandar Joshi and others on TriviaQA in 2017."
"Luke Zettlemoyer is a researcher who has co-authored publications on TriviaQA in 2017 and end-to-end neural coreference resolution in 2017."
"Diederik P Kingma is a researcher who has co-authored a publication on Adam: A method for stochastic optimization in 2015."
"Jimmy Ba is a researcher who has co-authored a publication with Diederik P Kingma on Adam: A method for stochastic optimization in 2015."
"Max Welling is a researcher who has co-authored a publication on semisupervised classification with graph convolutional networks in 2017."
"Jonathan Schwarz is a researcher who has co-authored a publication on the NarrativeQA reading comprehension challenge in 2018."
"Chris Dyer is a researcher who has co-authored a publication on the NarrativeQA reading comprehension challenge in 2018."
"Gabor Melis is a researcher who has co-authored a publication on the NarrativeQA reading comprehension challenge in 2018."
"Lee et al. (2017) are the authors of the coreference resolution study mentioned in the text."
"Kipf and Welling (2017) are the authors of the graph convolutional network (GCN) algorithm referenced in the text."
"Schlichtkrull et al. (2018) are the authors of the relational-GCNs algorithm, an extended version of the GCN algorithm."
"Peters et al. (2018) are the authors of the ELMo pre-trained bi-directional language model used in the text."
"Mikolov et al. (2013) are the authors of the word2vec model, which is mentioned in the text for comparison with ELMo."
"Pennington et al. (2014) are the authors of the GloVe model, which is mentioned as an alternative to ELMo in the text."
"Supporting documents are the documents used to organize mentions of candidate entities or query entities in a graph structure."
"Entity graph is the structure where nodes represent mentions of entities and are connected by different types of relations."
"Query entities are the entities that are being queried within the context of the entity graph."
"Candidate entities are the entities that are considered as potential answers within the context of the entity graph."
"DOC-BASED edges are the connections in the entity graph that represent co-occurrence of mentions within the same document."
"MATCH edges are the connections in the entity graph that represent identical named entity mentions."
"COREF edges are the connections in the entity graph that represent mentions in the same coreference chain."
"COMPLEMENT edge is the relation added between any two nodes in the entity graph that are not connected by any other relations."
"R-GCN refers to the relational graph convolutional network used for multi-step reasoning in the entity graph."
"ELMo is the pre-trained bi-directional language model used for encoding words in supporting documents and queries."
"Nodes in the entity graph represent mentions of either candidate entities or query entities and are connected by different types of relations."
"Mentions are instances of entities within the text that are represented as nodes in the entity graph."
"Coreference chains are sequences of mentions that the external coreference system predicts to be referring to the same entity."
"The external coreference system is used to predict coreference chains, which are then represented as COREF edges in the entity graph."
"A fully connected graph is the theoretical construct against which the entity graph's connectivity is compared to identify COMPLEMENT edges."
"Node representations are the continuous annotations associated with each node in the entity graph, representing an entity in the context it was mentioned."
"The differentiable message passing algorithm is used to propagate information through the entity graph, parameterized by a graph convolutional network."
"Multi-step reasoning is the process by which the model updates node representations in the entity graph through layers of R-GCN."
"Node indices are the identifiers for nodes in the entity graph, used to determine which nodes are mentions of a specific candidate answer."
"The parameterized affine transformation is used in the calculation of the probability of selecting a candidate as an answer in the entity graph."
"Contextualized word representations are the type of word encodings provided by ELMo, which depend on the entire text excerpt for each token representation."
"Character-based input representation is the method by which ELMo processes text, analyzing characters to create contextualized word representations."
"Non-contextualized word representations, such as those provided by GloVe, are word encodings that do not depend on the context of the entire text excerpt."

relationships.description: "Nodes in the entity graph represent mentions, which are the instances of entities within the text."
"Nodes in the entity graph can be connected by COREF edges, indicating that the mentions are in the same coreference chain."
"The external coreference system predicts coreference chains, which are sequences of mentions that refer to the same entity."
"Node representations in the entity graph represent mentions of entities, capturing the context in which they were mentioned."
"Multi-step reasoning involves updating node representations in the entity graph through layers of R-GCN."
"The parameterized affine transformation is used in conjunction with node indices to calculate the probability of selecting a candidate answer."
